reviewText:
First impression:  tough low-budget box-pusher with a twist

The twist is that you get two pushers, red and blue, and whenever red moves up, blue moves down and vice versa; left and right are also mirrored. There are colored obstacles that must be cleared by the correct pusher, and some require working together. This working together is the twist, and it's toughness showed just a few levels in when I was temporarily stuck in a position where the pushers would block themselves, and it required a small moment of inspiration to find a solution. Even earlier, I had to redo levels, since the mirror mechanic makes it difficult to move both avatars up to the same wall - and since I had destroyed the only aid I had for achieving this, I'd effectively gotten myself stuck. So it's challenging but fair, and requires quite a bit of thinking ahead.

The fact that the game is low-budget show itself in its low-budget look and some other annoyances. - I have to mention here that my previous review was negative because I was very annoyed with the fact that the exits were only revealed once you had basically solved the level; and having unbeknownst blocked the exit square earlier meant redoing the whole level. The developer took my criticism to heart and made it so that pressing Q now shows the exits, which makes the puzzles fair. Thank you! - I'd love to see fixes for the rest of my annoyances (did the characters gain some speed, or have I gotten used to it?), but for now they're acceptable: game runs with desktop resolution and (partially) cuts off the status bar on the left at 3:4 or 4:5 resolutions; controls are keyboard only and not reassignable; you can switch which character you control"
date: but there's no visual indication (maybe a glow or something?); and this game would really profit from multi-level undo.\n\nThe game may not look like much
voteText: and I can't remember having seen this mechanic before. Recommended."

reviewText: Decent puzzle game that has a Sokoban feel to it. I highly recommend that you give this little game a try especially if you are a puzzle game enthusiast. Well worth the money, regular or sale price.
